subject: Design
title: Pull-to-Refresh: The Satisfying Gesture
description: A short lesson to help you apply Pull-to-Refresh: The Satisfying Gesture.

hook.text: You pull down on your email app and it bounces back with new messages. That gesture was invented in 2008.

buildup.text: Loren Brichter designed pull-to-refresh for Tweetie, a Twitter client. Apple later adopted it.

discovery.text: The genius was mapping a physical metaphor â€” pulling a spring â€” to a digital action.

twist.text: Brichter patented it, but the gesture became so universal that enforcing the patent was impossible.

climax.text: Pull-to-refresh appears in virtually every mobile app. One gesture reshaped mobile interaction.

punchline.text: The best gestures feel like they always existed.
